column1: yorker to start off, just outside off. Jams it back to the bowler on the bounce
full toss at off stump, whipped out to long-on
flight and dip as this one drifts in at the pads. No forward movement as he looks to whip this  but that works in his favour. He gets it to dribble to short fine's right for his first runs
creamed. Forward push this time to reach this outside off and lift it with the turn, over mid-off
slower, full at off stump. Driven inside-out to extra cover cover
yorker length again, this time at off stump. Squeezed out to extra cover
good length and slanted across off stump. Stands tall and punches through the line, past the non-striker and mid-off
length outside off, no movement again. Punched on the up to cover
under-edge as looks to carve this length ball behind point. It skids through low. No feet from him either. Under-edge trickles through to the leeper
good length and wobbling a touch outside off, reaches out and drills this over cover on the rise
beauty. Not a bad pitch to bat on so far. Length ball sits up nicely outside off and he leans in to tap this on the rise to beat cover point to his left

...and he bowls short and wide outside off. Poor ball after the switch in field. Poor ball on most days, actually. Sits up nicely and he frees his arms to swat this with a horizontal bat, past mid-off
short ball and in at the hips. Lifts sharply as he closes his eyes and stabs at it. Manages to tickle it past short fine but that's not what he intended
beats the outside edge as he gets this to climb off a length as well. Patterson hangs his bat outside off

George Bailey has taken a sensational catch at extra cover! Does he know what he's done? That deserves more celebration than his signature grin. It's a back of a length ball climbing up at PAtterson, who closes the face too early and gets a leading edge. Bailey skips two steps in front and to his right at extra cover, then realises he's overdone the movement. Adjusts to go backwards at this point, one-handed to his right, and he hangs on
good length in the corridor, anxiously blocked on the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot, into the midwicket region
back of a length in the corridor, hurriedly tapped on the up to cover
145kph, starts with a big full toss, wide outside off. Saved by his extra pace. Watson can't get any timing on this swat outside off
low full toss at off stump, squeezed out to mid-off with the outside half of the bat
back of a length at leg stump, tapped to short fine on the up
back of a length in the corridor, prods at it and is beaten on the outside edge as Mills angles this across
143kph, length at leg stump. Whipped uppishly to deep backward square

151kph but short and wide. Buttler stays leg side of this and throws his hands with a square drive. Finds backward point to his left but that has absolutely flown and he can only parry it to the boundary
misfield at short third man. It's a short ball outside off, he opens the face and hits it straight to the fielder who is late getting down on it
short ball climbs and stings him on the glove as he looks to get behind the line and defend
short ball outside off, very late on the hook shot and there seems to be a sound as the ball flies through to Wade. A sound only him and I seem to have heard. No appeals
top edge lands in front of deep square. Once again, very late on the hook, but he got bat this time because it was closer to him
slower ball, back of a length at middle stump. Hangs deep in the crease and clips this through the open midwicket region
another slower ball, at a length and climbing at the ribs. Leading edge as he looks to flick this square
no-ball as this slower ball goes wrong and rises above the batsman's waist. It lobs up at the mid-riff and he can only squeeze it to short fine off the inside edge as he looks to pull
well bowled. Spears it in full at off stump, backs away to try and pierce the off side field but he can only jam it out to mid-off
shot! Slower ball, floated in at leg stump. Watson picks it, follows it with his hands, reaches the pitch and uses his wrists beautifully to clip this over the wide long-on fence
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot, with soft hands. Steals the single form point
back of a length in the corridor, opens the face and taps this to point
slower ball, dug in short at leg stump. Swivels and pulls. With no force. Can't beat short fine to his left
nicely done. It's dug in short again, and he swivels with perfect timing. Brings the bat out in front of his body and finds the long leg fence
full and outside off, bat turns in his hands as he looks to drive through the covers. Rolls back to the bowler
floated up outside off, takes it on the full and taps to long-off
short and wide outside off, hammered off the back foot but straight to sweeper cover
looped in at a length on off stump. He doesn't move his feet and is nearly beaten in flight as he jabs with hard hands
full at off stump, driven to long-off
length on middle stump, pushed back to the bowler on the up
good length slower ball at middle stump, chips it on the up towards long-on

ufff slaps this forehand right back at Christian, who is lucky it hits him on the calf in his run-up. No time to react. It was a length ball outside off and he got good bat on this. A single as the ball deflects into the midwicket area
full at off stump, clipped to long-on
full at middle stump, winds up on one knee and drives from under it. Can only drag it out to long-on, couple of bounces
short ball outside off, swivels and pulls handsomely, for a single out to deep midwicket
knee height full toss, wide outside off. The result was likely. Clobbers it off the meat of the bat, well wide of sweeper cover
good length at off stump, defended into the covers with the turn
back of a length outside off, waits on this and slices it through cover point
short ball in the corridor, backs away and punches to sweeper cover
drops it short outside off, but it comes on slow. He drags it out to deep midwicket with a pull
short ball outside off, cut to sweeper cover
short ball outside off, gets on top of the bounce and finds sweeper with the cut
good length, in at the stumps. Taps it into the covers with soft hands
length and in at middle stump. Stands tall and punches this back to the bowler
good length outside off, squeezed to midwicket off the inside half as he looks to drive through the covers
back of a length in the corridor, shuffles and exposes the stumps before guiding this to fine leg's right
full at middle stump and it's a sensational shot. Midwicket was brought in and he's found the gap nicely. Shuffles and punches with control, past the infielder
full slower ball outside off, shuffles and drills down to long-off
full at off stump, bit of grip and turn away. Driven on the up to extra cover
full outside off. Sets up for the reverse ramp but takes his eyes off it too early. Bunts it into the off side off the toe end and is denied a single
full toss at off stump, reverse sweep to deep cover's left
full and fired at leg stump. Gets down for the reverse sweep again but he's forced to drag this one. Hits it straight to point
full at middle stump, clipped between deep square and deep midwicket
full at leg stump, flicked out to deep midwicket
smash. The old swipes across the line on the back foot. Length ball at off stump, hangs back and clears long-on

108 metres! That's about the sweetest sound I've heard all year as Buttler makes connection on this. It's a full ball at off stump. His front leg is out of the way and the bat swing on the slog is so sweet. That is out of the ground
full and follows the batsman down leg side. Tapped to deep midwicket
top edge as Watson looks to pick up a length ball form outside off to try and clear midwicket. It lobs up in front of long-off who can't get there
and another. Drops it short, middle stump. Comes on politely to Buttler, who is backing away again and reaches above his head to hook and clear deep square to bring up his fifty
oh dear. 110 metres. This is some insane hitting. Inhuman. Backs away, gets a length ball at middle stump and clubs across the line to clear that same roof over midwicket yet again
full and in at leg stump, dragged out to deep midwicket off the inside edge
short of a length outside off, tries to play a reverse hoick and is beaten
short ball, spinning a  long way outside off. That was bowled to counter the switch hit, but there isn't one attempted this time
full and floated outside off, carted to long-off
short and wide outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
good length and wide outside off. Gets down on one knee and reaches out to bring out a slog sweep to beat deep midwicket to his right
slows it down, dipping length ball at off stump. Steps out, adjusts, pokes carefully into the off side
full toss at middle stump, gets in position for the reverse hit and finally manages to get hold of one. Ramps it over backward point
fired in full at middle stump, clears the front leg and drives to long-on

well bowled. Changes his trajectory and gets Buttler, who was backing away to try and open up the off side. It was lobbed up nicely, dipping into the crease at a middle stump line and he made too much room in the end. Tried to chop it over extra cover and missed
full at middle stump, driven against the turn to long-on
full at middle stump, plants the front leg forward and jabs it to long-on
good length outside off, sliced to backward point on the rise
back of a length and in at middle stump, glanced to deep square
drops it short outside off, hangs on the back foot and chops it expertly through point. Beats sweeper
short outside off, cut to backward point's right...where there is a misfield. Sweeper covers up this time
back of a length and pushed through at middle stump, dabbed to deep midwicket
floated up at middle stump, gets under it with a skip down the track and lifts it over the bowler's head
length and pushed through at middle stump, squeezed into the midwicket area off the back foot
good length at middle stump, gets under it too much as he goes for the slog sweep. Slices it high and it lands short of deep square leg
short ball wide outside off, chops it into the turf as he reaches out and tries to hammer this cut
back of a length, looks to tickle it fine and takes off for a run. Can't beat Wade and is forced to dive back. He would have been run out.

poor running and that's the end of Watson. Short ball in the hips. It's a short-arm pull towards deep square who is quick on the ball and has already reached it when Watson decideds to go for the second. It isn't his call at that angle but Ferguson hadn't run the first one hard either. Sends him back, but his turn is slow. And he doesn't have the momentum to put in a dive
good length at off stump, defended to point with an open face
short ball wide outside off, sliced to third man
slower ball, back of a length and wide outside off. Reaches out and pokes to extra cover on the up
back of a length outside off, runs the reverse sweep straight into Wade's boot
full at off stump, driven down to long-off
full at off stump, chips inside out to wide long-off

well that's an ugly way to go. Full toss at off stump that was prime for a big slog. He has premeditated the reverse sweep and gets in a poor position. Struck right in front of off stump, on the full, on his back leg. ABout as dead as it gets. Unless there was an inside edge on that
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
full at leg stump, gets down for the sweep and gets it to long leg's left...and once again, he can only do the single
slower ball dug in short, outside off. Drags it to deep square with a waft across the line
full toss outside off, driven to sweeper's right
back of a length and bursting through in the corridor. Splices this attempted pull to mid-off

attempted slower ball goes very wrong, but he gets away. It's 103kph, dug in behind halfway and wide outside off. Ferguson had backed away too much into the leg side. Could only squeeze it out to sweeper for a single
yorker in at middle stump and he can't get this away. Gets in a tangle in the crease
short ball rising up at off stump. Shapes for the pull but that is too quick off the surface for him. Off the splice again, to extra cover
slower bouncer, 107kph, following the batsman down leg side. He winds up and has to check his shot. Taps it feebly to short fine's left
143 kph, knee high full toss wide outside off. Steps out and makes it too quick for himself. Can't connect as he looks to go over cover
slower ball, full and in at off stump. Goes aerial, inside-out and clears extra cover

Arches drops the catch and tips it over the boundary at long-on. That would have been four overs without a boundary, if he had taken that. A simple one. Slower ball, full at middle stump. Looked to slog, didn't get too much power. It was slightly to Archer's right and the reverse cups failed him
slower ball, back of a length outside off. Opens the face to try and run it through third man. Gets an inside edge that runs through to Wade. Ferguson manages to steal a single
back of a length wide outside off, slices it on the bounce to sweeper
full and in at off stump. It's there to be put away, but it wobbles very late and takes the inside edge as he looks to bludegon it on the up. Dribbles to deep midwicket's left and they get two
full outside off, backs away and finds extra cover with the drive. Mid-off was in. Another boundary chance missed. They can't get an extra run on the overthrows to square leg
short ball and in at the body, backs away, looks to pull. Gets a top edge that clears short fine
good length outside off, looks to pummel on the up, but can only slice it in long-on's direction
overpitched on middle stump, backs away and looks to slog. Drags it out to deep square off the inside edge

nasty bouncer up at his throat. He can't get the pull away. It's off the glove and rolling back at the bowler. Who picks up as he realises they're trying to steal a run. Holds his nerve, runs backward and under-arms it to break the stumps
back of a length, fired across off stump, beaten on the outside edge
full and angled across off stump. Throws his hands at this but it's moving away from his body weight. He slices over extra cover
short and wide, anticipates the angle this time and slaps it through cover
yorker at off stump, watchfully tapped to extra cover
short ball outside off, cut to point
full and in at leg stump, nudged through midwicket on the front foot
full and slight hint of inswing. Sliced on the up to point
shot. Runs his hands through the line of this length ball as it angles across him. Lifts it over point cleanly
good length at off stump, defended to point with an open face
short ball on leg stump, hangs back and arches slightly as he ramps this over short fine
picks the slower ball and clobbers it across the line to clear the square leg boundary. It was a length ball on middle and he backed away to make room for the swing
length ball at middle stump, defended into the off side
yorker just outside off, fizzes off the outside edge as he jams the bat down on it. Watson slow as he crouches to his left. Bursts through him along the floor

bowled him! That's a nice sight if you're bowler-inclined. Length ball with a hint of shape inside. Not too quick, it's 134kph, but it's skiddy. Short exposes middle and off as he swings across the line. Gets an inside edge and the stumps light up
good length and in the corridor, pushed into the covers on the front foot
good length and in the corridor. Thick outside edge to third man as he punches on the up
oh nicely placed. This back of a length ball is wide outside off, but it isn't rising too much. He does well to bring his bat from under it and carve it over point
back of a length outside off, this one climbs past the outside edge as he looks to cut

close lbw appeal as he's struck right in front of middle and leg. it's very full and not there for the sweep, which he goes for. But the bowler is bowling around the wicket and that might have influenced the not out decision
good length outside off, pushed into the covers on the front foot
low full toss at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
back of a length skidder at middle stump, under-edges the pull and gets it to deep midwicket's right
full toss at leg stump, flicked to long-on
slow and drifting wide of off stump, but he does well to lean in and use his wrists to drop this well in front of deep midwicket
back of a length at leg stump, tickled to short fine with the help of his thigh guard

good catch running backwards from Buttler. McDermott steps out and looks to whip one over midwicket on the up. This length ball rises on him as he does so and it's a top-edge that's in the awkward area between first slip and third man. Buttler makes it clear he's going for it, gets third man to abort his attempt. Then settles under it and follows nicely with his gloves as it swerves to his right
back of a length at leg stump, clips it off his thigh to deep square's right
back of a length at off stump, punched to point off the back foot
good length, starts outside leg and goes straight down
good length at off stump, punched back to the bowler on the bounce
good length at middle stump, punched to mid-on on the rise
back of a length at middle stump, tucked wide of mid-on from the crease
back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers off the back foot
full and just outside off, reaches out with his hands and drives on the up to mid-off
back of a length outside off, sliced to backward point
good length at leg stump, whipped to short fine leg
slower ball, good length at off stump. Opens the face and taps it into the point area with soft hands
full at leg stump, flicked to long-on
full at leg stump, drilled to long-on
good length, wide outside off. Expansive drive on the up to sweeper's right
good length at off stump, pushed back towards the bowler of the back foot
full at leg stump, flicked between deep square and deep midwicket
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper
good length and straight through to leg stump, big stride forward to flick into the square leg area
full and in at off stump, driven inside-out to extra cover

chips it to long-off in surprisingly casual style. He was looking to go wide, but this one dipped on him rapidly outside off and his jab was met with a climbing ball. A few yards to long-off's left and it's a simple catch for a big wicket
floated up at off stump, driven back firmly at the bowler who fumbles in his follow through
back of a length and pushed across the left-hander, who leaves it alone
googly at a length outside off, leans in and drives off the outside half to point
good length outside off, looks to guide it pitchside with soft hands. Point swoops down on it quickly
back of a length just outside off, nudged through cover point off the back foot
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
good length outside off, gets down for the paddle sweep and cops it on the body

chipped back to the bowler and it's another soft dismissal. Things looking dull as the required rate approaches 10. Another example of dip doing the batsman in. It grips too and stops on Wade as he looks to push with hard hands through the covers against this length ball. Not to the pitch of it and it's a harmless bunt back to Nair

Boyce has come in and been completely flummoxed first ball. There's a stumping appeal against him. He's looking to flick this full ball from outside off, expecting the offspinner. But this drifts away. His back leg is dragged out and it looks like he's just managed to get something behind the line. He survives.
back of a length outside off, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
good length and in at off stump, no feet as he defends
good length just outside off, pushed wide of extra cover with the turn

they're losing it completely against the spinners. Midwicket is in, and the promoted Boyce plays a half-hearted sweep in his attempt to clear him. That wouldn't have gone too far in this wind if he had really swung at it, so he stands nearly no chance after this. It's slow through the air and on middle stump, he ends up getting it off the toe-end to midwicket
full at leg stump, driven aerially to long-on
good length, flat and in at leg stump. Pushed into the midwicket region off the inside half of the bat
full at leg stump, skips down a step and drives to long-on
good length outside off, no feet as he exposes his stumps and looks to punch on the up. Gets an inside edge to short fine
back of a length outside off, backs away and punches aerially towards sweeper
back of a length and in at off stump, shapes for the cut but is forced to adjust as it skids through. Taps it through point
finds long-on with the slog sweep. Length ball outside off, reaches out for it and gets well under it. Ends up a slice, taken quite a way inside the boundary
full and just outside off, sliced to sweeper's left
good length at leg stump, steps out and drives to long-on, against the turn
googly, not picked. Stretches forward and is beaten on the inside edge. Struck on the front pad. No appeal
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's right
beauty. Good length, drifting in at off stump, spinning and climbing rapidly past the outside edge. No feet at all from the batsman
good length and pushed through flat at off stump. Defended on the back foot

he's missed another googly and this one is through to Buttler who has taken the bails off really quickly...or has he? He certainly made the action, but he has completely missed the bails on the first attempt as the foot's outside the crease...and the foot is back in when he recovers and makes proper contact. So nearly a great piece of wicketkeeping. It certainly was a great piece of bowling. Full and dipping on a middle stump line and drawing him in
good length carrom ball outside off, slashes outside the line, beaten on the inside edge
good length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length at leg stump, flicked to short fine's left

quick stumping again, but this one looks a lot safer for the batsman. Really quick hands once more. It's been sent upstairs. Steps out and misses this outside off as it skids past him. And once again, saved marginally
full at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
back of a length in the corridor, dabbed to backward point
back of a length outside off, steps out, nowhere near the pitch. Punched to sweeper cover
leading edge as he looks to flick this length ball. Sticks in the pitch and ends up going over the bowler's head
short ball outside off, cut to sweeper cover
back of a length in the corridor, cut straight to point
quicker one, front of the hand. Length at middle. Shovels it to midwicket
short ball outside off, punched forcefully to sweeper cover
misses the full one and loses leg stump. That should be the end of any outside chance they had. It's speared in from around and he gets cramped on the attempted slog
yorker at leg stump, flicked to long-on
good length, floated up outside off. Chopped to sweeper cover
slap and one clears the boundary at long last. Length ball outside off, reaches out, swings clean and clears long-on with a flat one
yorker outside off, squeezed to extra cover's left
full at middle stump, driven to extra cover
good length and follows him down leg side. He guides it to backward point...who throws and gives away a run through midwicket
slower ball, good length and outside off. Swipes across the line and gets a big inside edge that dribbles past short fine. Fawad gives chase and <strike>slides</strike> falls and pulls it back in
short and in at leg stump, backs away and guides it to third man
pummels this full wide ball, sweeper does really well to reach that and put in a slide
short ball outside off, guided to third man
slower ball, full and at middle stump. Chips it over mid-off as he backs away into the leg side. Good option
slower ball, full toss. Wide outside off. Can't get bat on the massive heave
full toss outside off, backs away to try and punch through the off side. Can only manage to chip it over the bowler off the toe-end
slower short ball outside off, backs away and guides to deep backward point
bouncer dug in too short, he leaves it alone
slower ball, good length and in the corridor. Swings at it, beaten
slower ball, full and wide outside off. Gets down on one knee and clubs it off the toe-end. Between long-on and long-off
low full toss, wide outside off. Reaches out and taps it off the toe-end again. To deep extra cover
yorker at leg stump, whips it straight into his toe...off the toe-end
yorker at leg stump, can only manage to jam it out to long-on
he gets all of this but he can't clear the boundary. Floated up slow outside off. Backs away and swings for the long boundary. Can't beat long-off
crafty. Anticipates the yorker on leg stump, gets outside the line, picks it on the full and paddles it past short fine
good length at middle stump, can't get to the pitch for this slog. It lands short of deep midwicket
back of a length, pushed through fast in the corridor. No feet, looks to nudge it past short third man. Beaten

another one off the toe-end. Might have had 15 extra runs on another day. Backs away, lines up to this slower ball outside off and swings across the line. Everythign right about it other than the connection. Lands well in front of deep midwicket
nicely done. Outfoxes the No. 10 batsman completely with a loopy slower ball that appear to be a beamer, but ends up sneaking through from under the bat because it's a yorker
short ball, flying across middle stump. Backs away and swings, beaten
slower ball, back of a length on leg stump and cutting away. Past his outside edge as he looks to guide it past short third
yorker does too much and tails away from off stump, Mills doesn't do a lot but gets away
slower yorker outside off, gets underneath it and manages to chip it wide of the non-striker whilst looking at the point boundary
bouncer at off stump, backs away and hoicks. Beaten
slower ball at a length on middle stump, looks to lift this over extra cover. Beaten and it climbs over the stumps
back of a length, in at his body. It takes a deflection off his pad and crashes into the stumps as he tries to carve one through the off side
